STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
July 14, 2025
Jamie L Lemay
MARQUETTE/ALGER/SCHOOLCRAFT MDHHS
234 W BARAGA AVE,
MARQUETTE, MI, 49855-4710
Re: License #: CP520201281
Dear Ms. Lemay:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
06/25/2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Sanantha Way, Area Manager, at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Doug Turrill, Licensing Consultant
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City, MI 49684
231-383-5531
enclosure
2

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with all
the following information before the placement or
replacement of a child:
• (h) Any other known information to enable
the foster parent to provide a stable, safe,
and healthy environment for the foster child
and the foster family, including information
about siblings who do not reside in the
foster home as provided in federal law.
One of three files reviewed did not document that the foster parent received other
known information to enable the foster parent to provide a stable, safe, and healthy
environment for the foster child and family, including information about siblings.
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with all
the following information before the placement or
replacement of a child:
• (d) Any known history of abuse or neglect
of the child.
2

One of three files reviewed did not document that the foster parent received any
known history of abuse or neglect of the child before placement.
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with all
the following information before the placement or
replacement of a child:
• (e) All known emotional and psychological
factors relating to the care of the child.
One of three files reviewed did not document that the foster parent received all
known emotional and psychological factors relating to the care of the child before
placement.
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with all
the following information before the placement or
replacement of a child:
• (f) All known behaviors of the child.
One of three files reviewed did not document that the foster parent received all
known behaviors of the child before placement.
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with all
the following information before the placement or
replacement of a child:
• (g) Circumstances necessitating placement
or replacement of the child.
One of three files reviewed did not document that the foster parent received
information necessitating placement or replacement of the child before placement.
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with all
the following information before the placement or
replacement of a child:
• (a) Child's name.
3

One of three files reviewed did not document that the foster parent was given the
child's name before placement.
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with all
the following information before the placement or
replacement of a child:
• (b) Child's date of birth.
One of three files reviewed did not document that the foster parent received the
child's date of birth before placement.
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with all
the following information before the placement or
replacement of a child:
• (c) Available known information about the
child's health.
One of three files reviewed did not document that the foster parent received
available known information about the child's health before placement.
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (5) An agency shall involve the child's parent or
parents and the foster parents in the development
of service plans to enable the parent or parents
and foster parents to understand the plan for the
child and the parents' and the foster parent's role
in assisting the agency in carrying out the plan. An
agency shall give a copy to and review the parent-
agency treatment plan with the parent or parents
and foster parents. The agency must inform the
parent or parents and foster parent that the
information in the parent-agency treatment plan
and any other information about the child and the
child's family is confidential.
One of three files reviewed contained a PATP that lacked signatures and
confirmation of involvement.
4

CPA Rule 400.12421 Visitation and family time; in person contact
• (2) An agency social service worker shall visit the
foster child, and the foster parent, if applicable, in
the child's placement at least once every month.
One out of three files reviewed did not document a narrative for an in home social
work contact that occurred on 5-5-2025
CPA Rule 400.12502 Program statement
• (2) An agency shall give a copy of the program
statement to a youth before placement in
independent living.
One of one independent files reviewed did not document that the youth received the
agency independent living program statement.
CPA Rule 400.12503 Policy and procedures
• (3) An agency shall provide a youth in
independent living with a copy of the agency's
policies and procedures required by this rule.
One out of one independent living files reviewed did not document that the
independent living youth received the agency independent living policies and
procedures.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:.
• Technical assisted was provided in the following areas: The agency was
informed that DCWL is no longer auditing any DHHS Policy. DCWL
Consultants will only be auditing those rules described in the "Licensing
Rules For Child Placing Agencies" rule book.
• The agency was also informed that a social work contact documenting
that the foster care worker reviewed the PATP with the foster parent and
other relevant parities and provided them with a copy of the treatment plan
would meet the rule when obtaining signatures was not possible.
5

V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was not requested or required at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: The
agency submitted one CAP during the licensing period. The CAP was approved
on 7-24-24 and was in response to those rule violations established during the 5-
24-2024 renewal inspection. During the inspection the agency was cited for R
400.12311 Parent Agency Agreement, R 40012418 Development of service plans,
FOM 722-08d Treatment Plans, FOM 722-06b Family Team Meetings, and Fom-
722-06h Case Contacts. The current inspection did not establish repeat violations.
There were no special investigations of the agency during this licensing period.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrators Assessment was reviewed. The assessment reviewed
the rule violations established during the 2024 renewal inspection. The
assessment documents efforts and strategies to prevent rule violations. The
assessment reported that there are no identified barriers to maintaining
compliance with the rules.
Financial Overview
The agency is a local DHHS office and financial records were not available.
Staff Interviews
Staff interviewed reported feeling supported by their respective supervisors. Staff
added that they feel they are part of a supportive agency team. Staff did report
that the requirements of the job are often difficult to meet as there is not enough
time.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is located in a modern DHHS building in Marquette. There is sufficient
office space for staff. CHRI documents were observed to be secured as required.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The CPA Analyst did not identify any safety concerns while visiting the homes.
6

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
July 9, 2025
________________________________________
Douglas W Turrill Date
Licensing Consultant
